page.title: 09PITTINGTON HILL
page.content:
The hill at Pittington is a { {Magnesium Limestone }outcrop, 175 metres above sea level.It has a SW to NW facing aspect on its escarpment side.The escarpment was created by limestone quarrying in the last century. As part of the Science in our school we have studied the flora of the hill month by month beginning in March. In March only daisies and dandelions where found.
April-daisy,dandelion,cowslip,violet, white dead nettle,red dead nettle, coltsfoot, gorse,celandine,bugle, two types of chickweed,bird's eye, buttercup.
